* Therefore, the most accurate paraphrase of "ヘルパー/パート・アルバイト" would be "介護職（有資格）", which means "caregiver (qualified)" in English.

Note:

* 無資格 means "unqualified" or "not certified," so option C. 介護職（無資格） means "caregiver (unqualified)" in English.
* Option D. 介護職／正社員 means "caregiver/full-time employee" in English, which is not a paraphrase of the original phrase.
* Option E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト means "caregiver/part-time or casual worker" in English, which is not a paraphrase of the original phrase.
* Option F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員 means "caregiver (qualified)/full-time employee" in English, which is not a paraphrase of the original phrase.
* Option G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト means "caregiver (qualified)/part-time or casual worker" in English, which is not a paraphrase of the original phrase.

prompt.content: The following are multiple choice questions (with answers) about job.

Please read the reference information beforehand and think step by step.
[Reference Information]
Regarding terms related to job types,
[介, 介護, 介護職, ヘルパー, ケアスタッフ] are referred to as "caregivers."(in Japanese, "介護職")

There are three terms related to employment types: [正社員, パート・アルバイト, 契約社員].
[正, 正職, 正社員] are considered "full-time employees" (in Japanese, "正社員").
[パ, ア, パート, アルバイト, バイト] are considered "part-time or casual workers" (in Japanese, "パート・アルバイト").
[契, 契約, 契約社員] are considered "contract employees" (in Japanese, "契約社員").

Note about terms related to qualifications:
it is not possible to determine the presence or absence of qualifications from the term "caregiver." Even without a caregiving qualification, it is possible to work as a caregiver.

[Question] Choose the most accurate paraphrase of "ヘルパー／パート・アルバイト" from the options below.

A. 介護職
B. 介護職（有資格）
C. 介護職（無資格）
D. 介護職／正社員
E. 介護職／パート・アルバイト
F. 介護職（有資格）／正社員
G. 介護職（有資格）／パート・アルバイト
Answer:
